Package tools.gui

Class Button2

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.AbstractButton
            • tools.gui.Button2
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.ItemSelectable, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.SwingConstants
    @Deprecated(forRemoval=true)
public class Button2
extends javax.swing.AbstractButton
    Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
    This class relies heavily on ImageManager, which was completely refactored, and behaviour of this class has not yet been tested with the new implementation.
    Button-like users should use SheetButton instead, as the dependancy with the ImageManager is completely removed there.
    Customizable button class via images.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Button2

        public Button2​(int sizeX,
               int sizeY,
               int barSize,
               java.awt.Image[][] img,
               int type)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Creates a Button2 with the given size and bar size. type determines the algorithm that is used to generate the button. Must be one of: - Button2.TYPE_TURNED This generates the corners by rotating them. - Button2.TYPE_MIRRORED This generates teh corners by mirroring them. scaleType determines the scale type which is used to scale the images. Must be one of: - Image.SCALE_AREA_AVERAGING - Image.SCALE_DEFAULT - Image.SCALE_FAST - Image.SCALE_REPLICATE - Image.SCALE_SMOOTH img depends on the the type: - For Button2.TYPE_TURNED and Button2.TYPE_MIRRORED, the following is assumed about img: o img[0][0] contains the overlay of the upper left corner. o img[1][0] contains the overlay of the uppper bar. o img[2][0] contains the overlay of the center part o img[0][x] with 1 <= x < 4 contain the backgrounds for the corners. o img[1][x] with 1 <= x < 4 contain the backgrounds for the edges. o img[2][x] with 1 <= x < 4 contain the backgrounds for the center part.

        public void setImage​(java.awt.Image image,
                     int barWidth,
                     int barHeight,
                     boolean resize)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Sets the given image as icon image
        Parameters:
        image - the new image of the buttons.
        barWidth - the width size of the bar of the button that is still visible.
        barHeight - the height size of the bar of the button that is still visible.
        resize - whether the image should be resized to have an equal border on all sides.

      • setText

        public void setText​(java.lang.String text)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        If there was no label set, create a new label with the text and add it to the button. Otherwise change the text.
        Overrides:
        setText in class javax.swing.AbstractButton
        Parameters:
        text - new text of the button.

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled​(boolean enable)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        en/disables button. When enabled: A press of the mouse button when the mouse is over the button notifies all ActionListeners. Also the background is changed accordingly. When disabled: The button ignores the mouse. The background is always "backgroundDisabled". When is already enabled and is enabled again (and vice verca for disabled), nothing happens.
        Overrides:
        setEnabled in class javax.swing.AbstractButton
        Parameters:
        enable - whether the button should be enabled or disabled. Note: super.setEnabled(enable) sometimes gives a random NullPointerException (mainly when the button is not yet (fully) drawn. Not certain what to do with this.

        public boolean isPressed()
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Returns:
        true iff the mouse is currently over the button and pressed. Does NOT depend on its current state. Use "calculateType()" to determine the current state.

      • isHoover

        public boolean isHoover()
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Returns:
        true iff the mouse is currently over the button. Does NOT depend on its current state.

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Overrides:
        isEnabled in class java.awt.Component
        Returns:
        true iff the button is enabled. Does NOT depend on its current state. False otherwise.
